intro: Hillia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited hillia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
